column4: I get an error message at startup stating that the daeomn winbind can't be started. What's the daemon winbind for? Should I worry about that?
that's related to either samba or active directory... what do you use for email etc?
Nothing, no e-amil provider.
what version do you have? 9.10?
nothing, no e-mail provider. Using lucid lynx.
what's daemon winbind for? What's Samba for?
samba is for sharing files with the windows samba / smb protocol
also used in active directory and other ms stuff
try opening a terminal and typing 'winbindd'
so what shouldn't work if winbind does not start? What should I check out?
first see if you can get a more specific error message
tyed it,
what happened?
typed it, nothing happened.
no error?
no text whatsoever.
well, you can probably just remove it from your startup
System>Preferences>Startup Applications
I possibly killed it as a process from the system monitor, once it happened that the system was stuck....
it doesn't seem to be among the startup applications. What should I look for?
try setting permissions on all the samba config files: sudo chmod -R 755 /etc/samba
